results.title: Towards a modern Europe: the Renaissance
results.creator_credit: John Dooley and Polonius Film Services
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “An Outline History of Europe”.
Explains and illustrates the transition from the Middle Ages to the Renaissance, including the principles of the new study and attitudes in art, architecture and scholarship

results.title: Towards 2000: Robots and Energy
results.brief_description: The Robots are Coming- More and more jobs are being taken over each year by the robots of the world. Most of the jobs are tedious, but the robots don’t seem to mind. “Energy”- The sun and the wind could supply us with most of our energy needs - pollution free. “Research Into Space”- The Americans and the Russians are showing the world that space has no boundaries but getting up there does present problems from time to time. “Other Changes”- Electronic bagpipes and a hotel room the size of a phone box - they are just two of the changes taking place right now.

results.title: Toward intimacy (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Debbie McGee, Nicole Hubert and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A woman with a disability retains both her sexuality and her right to seek, develop and sustain a relationship with the partner of her choice. In this documentary, four disabled women from across Canada share their personal experiences and raise important issues including sexuality, self-esteem, stereotyping and parenting. It is their opportunity to say, “this is the way it is and not the way you think it is”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Debbie McGee, Nicole Hubert and ONF | NFB

results.title: Toward emotional security
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Psychology for Living”.
Aims to assist adolescents in understanding and controlling their emotions. Tells of an eighteen-year-old girl, faced with a decision involving her feelings for her parents and a young man. She recalls episodes from her early life in which love, fear and hate were not always controlled and is then able to make a decision that shows her emotional growth.

results.title: Toute la Memoire du Monde = All the Memory of the World
results.brief_description:
Following the journey of a book from its arrival at the Legal Deposit office, rue de Richelieu, to the consultation room, Alain Resnais takes the audience through the meanders of the French National Library and the treasures it contains. Resnais instructed his crew that he wanted to move through the library like a fish in water or like a rocket. This explains the fluidity of the travelling and tacking shots which gave the film such a dynamism while the subject was totally inert.

Credits: Producer, Pierre Braunberger ; director, Alain Resnais ; writer, Remo Forlani ; photography, Ghislain Cloquet ; music, Maurice Jarre, Georges Delerue.
Cast: Jacques Dumesnil [narration only].

results.title: Tout va bien
results.creator_credit: Jean-Pierre Gorin, Jean-Luc Godard, Empire Films, Vicco Films and Anouchka Films
results.brief_description: An American broadcaster and a former film director go to a factory to interview the manager about modern managerial methods and find it occupied by the workers who take them hostage. Supporters of the working class and student uprising that took place in France in 1968, they are forced to re-examine their commitment to the struggle and to each other. The film wittily examines the position of three major social forces in French society and the contradictions between them: the bourgeoisie, the working class and intellectuals. The basic concern is the part an intellectual can play in revolutionary movement of the working class. Cast includes Yves Montand and Jane Fonda.

results.title: Tout L'or du Monde = All the Gold in the World
results.brief_description:
Dumont, an obstinate peasant, his son and cousin refuse to sell their land with its health-giving water spring to property developers anxious to turn the place into a fashionable spa. This late comedy of Rene Clair makes fun of all the trappings of modernity. Bourvil has a lot of fun playing all the members of the uncompromising Dumont family.

Credits: Producer, Jacques Plante ; director, Rene Clair ; writers, Rene Clair, Jean Marsan, Jacques Remy ; photography, Pierre Petit ; music, Georges van Parys.
Cast: Annie Fratellini, Bourvil, Colette Castel, Philippe Noiret, Francoise Dorleac, Alfred Adam.
